info.title: DotAAS Part 2 | HTTP/REST | Asset Administration Shell Registry Service Specification
info.description:
The Full Profile of the Asset Administration Shell Registry Service Specification as part of the [Specification of the Asset Administration Shell: Part 2](http://industrialdigitaltwin.org/en/content-hub).  
Publisher: Industrial Digital Twin Association (IDTA) 2023

protocol.description: Allows access through http and https (recommended)

host_name.description: Hostname of server hosting the api

port.description: 80 is default for http, 443 for https

get.summary: Returns all Asset Administration Shell Descriptors

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of elements in the response array

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: A server-generated identifier retrieved from pagingMetadata that specifies from which position the result listing should continue

400.description: Bad Request, e.g. the request parameters of the format of the request body is wrong.

default.description: Default error handling for unmentioned status codes

post.summary: Creates a new Asset Administration Shell Descriptor, i.e. registers an AAS

201.description: Asset Administration Shell Descriptor created successfully

Location.description: URL of the newly created resource

400.description: Bad Request, e.g. the request parameters of the format of the request body is wrong.

409.description: Conflict, a resource which shall be created exists already. Might be thrown if a Submodel or SubmodelElement with the same ShortId is contained in a POST request.

default.description: Default error handling for unmentioned status codes

get.summary: Returns a specific Asset Administration Shell Descriptor

parameters.name: aasIdentifier
parameters.description: The Asset Administration Shell’s unique id (UTF8-BASE64-URL-encoded)

400.description: Bad Request, e.g. the request parameters of the format of the request body is wrong.

default.description: Default error handling for unmentioned status codes

put.summary: Updates an existing Asset Administration Shell Descriptor

parameters.name: aasIdentifier
parameters.description: The Asset Administration Shell’s unique id (UTF8-BASE64-URL-encoded)

204.description: Asset Administration Shell Descriptor updated successfully

400.description: Bad Request, e.g. the request parameters of the format of the request body is wrong.

default.description: Default error handling for unmentioned status codes

delete.summary: Deletes an Asset Administration Shell Descriptor, i.e. de-registers an AAS

parameters.name: aasIdentifier
parameters.description: The Asset Administration Shell’s unique id (UTF8-BASE64-URL-encoded)

204.description: Asset Administration Shell Descriptor deleted successfully

400.description: Bad Request, e.g. the request parameters of the format of the request body is wrong.

default.description: Default error handling for unmentioned status codes

parameters.description: The Asset Administration Shell’s unique id (UTF8-BASE64-URL-encoded)

400.description: Bad Request, e.g. the request parameters of the format of the request body is wrong.

default.description: Default error handling for unmentioned status codes

get.summary: Returns the self-describing information of a network resource (ServiceDescription)

default.description: Default error handling for unmentioned status codes

ServiceDescription.description: The Description object enables servers to present their capabilities to the clients, in particular which profiles they implement. At least one defined profile is required. Additional, proprietary attributes might be included. Nevertheless, the server must not expect that a regular client understands them.

bad-request.description: Bad Request, e.g. the request parameters of the format of the request body is wrong.

default.description: Default error handling for unmentioned status codes

conflict.description: Conflict, a resource which shall be created exists already. Might be thrown if a Submodel or SubmodelElement with the same ShortId is contained in a POST request.
